title: Sadio Mane took pride in Lionel Messi voting for him as World Player of the Year
text:
Liverpool star Sadio Mane has described Lionel Messi's vote for him in the FIFA The Best award as a 'great compliment'.

Even though Liverpool dramatically dumped Barcelona out at the semi-final stage of last season's Champions League, Messi clearly didn't bear any grudges.

The Argentine star voted for Senegal forward Mane when asked to pick his player of the year for 2019.

Sadio Mane described Lionel Messi's vote for him in FIFA's Best award as a 'great compliment'

Barcelona star Messi won the FIFA award back in September but lent his vote to Mane

In the end, Messi scooped the aware ahead of Mane's Liverpool team-mate Virgil van Dijk and Cristiano Ronaldo of Juventus, with Mane fifth behind another colleague Mohamed Salah.

Mane said: 'It's a great compliment when Messi votes for you. If you look at where I've come from, it shows I've come quite far.

'All I can say [to kids] is to keep working hard and go for your dream.'

Mane in action against Barcelona in the semi-finals of last season's Champions League

Mane has enjoyed an excellent start to the season, scoring eight goals in 11 matches so far

Mane scored 26 goals in 50 matches for Liverpool last season with his tally of 22 in the Premier League earning a share of the Golden Boot with Salah and Arsenal's Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.

And having helped Liverpool win the Champions League, Mane has continued where he left off at the start of this season, with eight goals and two assists in 11 matches.

Both Mane and Messi will be in contention for the prestigious Ballon D'Or, which will be awarded in December.

Messi has won the accolade five times, the same number as Ronaldo, but their decade-long monopoly on the award was ended by Luka Modric last year.
description: Liverpool star Sadio Mane has described Lionel Messi's vote for him in the FIFA Best award as a 'great compliment'. Mane came fifth in the vote as Messi carried off the award.
